channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023060914
item.description:
Report X-2023060914

  • State: CO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was placed in the sorter when it should of went through the sorter due to pkg. being oxidizer/corrosive facer noticed outer carton wet and pulled and brought down to QA in a lined tote. DescribePack: Loose closures was the cause of this damage due to pkg. handler placing in sorter. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Facer placed inside a lined tote and brought down from sorter due to pkg. being wet and QA placed inside hazmat cage to get inspected.

DescribePack: Crack was located near bottom of bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Clean up and put in tub.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was identified that a 5 gallon container was leaking from a pin hole leak on the bottom of the container while loading a trailer. The spill was cleaned up and the leaking container was overpacked prior to transportation. The leak was due to a puncture from a nail on a pallet.

Loose cap on same jerrican allowed leakage which damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

DescribePack: Glass jugs in molded pulp top and bottom trays inside corrugated carton. One jug shattered, allowing spillage which damaged trays and carton and caused top tape and shipping label to fall off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

DescribePack: Loose closures was the cause of this damage and about 2 cups leaked out total soiling another pkg. inside trailer as well. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Placed in a lined hazmat tote

item.title: Report X-2023060433
item.description:
Report X-2023060433

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: COMMERCE CITY
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS PICKED UP FOR SHIPMENT BY A DRIVER DURING HIS PICK UP ROUTE. RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SPILL LOCATION AND ARRIVED WEARING PROPER PPE. THE PACKAGE AND SPILLED CONTENTS WERE CONTAINED FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION AT THE DMP, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. DURING PROCESSING RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE CONTAINER WAS CRACKED AND EMPTY, THE BOX AND PACKING MATERIALS WERE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

DescribePack: Loose closure was the cause of this damage about cup leaked out soiling inner bottles and outer carton. item.title: Report X-2023051263
item.description:
Report X-2023051263

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: LITTLETON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 10th, and undeclared dangerous goods shipments were discovered during AM inbound sort. Tracking numbers are 398090517829 and 398090517910. Per packaging, it contains UN 1760 Corrosive Liquid, N.O.S (Contains Hydrochloric Acid). A jerry can with class 8 corrosive label was shipped with an outer packaging of a fiberboard box which had no DG markings or labels indicating that it contains DG. The outer packaging got wet during transit, and there are no visible leak from the jerry can. DG Admin advised putting the packages into a salvage drum and to hold until further instructed.

item.description:
Report E-2023050557

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 5, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was punctured during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Hazmat Services, Inc. (EHS) to remediate the impacted site. EHS personnel utilized granular absorbents and swept them in using hand tools. The crew containerized all impacted material into one (1) 5-gallon drum for disposal.
